name: WASP-82
scenarioDescription:
The WASP-82 Exoplanetary System


Overview

WASP-82 is a star with 1.48 times the mass of the Sun, and 2.1 times its radius. It is located NaN light years away from the solar system.

WASP-82 is known to have undefined exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the WASP-82 system


WASP-82 b

WASP-82 b was discovered by the undefined observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of WASP-82 b is 372.06 times the mass of Earth. The radius of WASP-82 b is 18.159 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, WASP-82 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system WASP-82, which contains undefined planets and was discovered by undefined.
